messages.content: Dear Island Resident, It's time for a change! The General Election on May 6th will be your opportunity to elect a Liberal Democrat MP for the Island again.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The Liberal Democrats are the only realistic alternative who got 17% of the Isle of Wight voting Labour, nor the Conservatives or any of the last General election, or for other parties will only strengthen the Conservatives.

issues.environment: Organisations and campaigns I actively support include Friends of the Earth
issues.health: Christian Aid, Maternity Services Liaison Committee (Chairman), 'Save the Military Road'

leaflet.personalStatement: The Island has been home to me, my husband and our three children for twenty five years. Our children all went to school locally and know the importance of having a good education. My husband is self-employed and we know how hard it can be when money is tight.

politicalExperience.achievements: With the support of local communities, we have successfully campaigned on many issues ranging from saving businesses and local post offices to renewing children's playgrounds. One of our proudest achievements was to bring Homestart to the Island to support young families.

endorsements.endorsement: If you want an energetic and active MP who will work with Liberal Democrat MPs and MEPs to fight for funds and resources the Island rightly deserves, then please give me your support and vote Liberal Democrat on Thursday 6th May.

images.caption: Jill with her children on Compton Beach
Jill the activist joining in with demonstrators to keep our small schools
Jill with Liberal Democrat leader Nick Clegg
